_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Carbon Filter, Chemical Feed Pumps, Containment Area
_prev_prog_2.Description: This process includes both TDI tanks. The TDI tanks are pumped from the storage tanks into a chemical reactor tank. The TDI is blended into other ingredients, diluting and reacting it for finished product purposes.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
SUMMARY
Stockmeier Urethanes, Inc.
June 2011

General Facility Information
Name of Facility:    Stockmeier Urethanes USA, Inc.

Facility Address:    20 Columbia Boulevard
            Clarksburg, WV 26301

Facility Contact:
Name:                Michael Robinson
Title:            Vice President Operations
Telephone:        (304) 624-7002
Mailing Address:    P.O. Box 1456
            Clarksburg, WV 26302

Owner:        Stockmeier Group, Germany


Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) Code: 2821 Chemical Blending

Designated Name: Stockmeier Urethanes USA

WV Permit Number: WVNPDES Permit Number: WVG611115


Emergency Contacts:
Name:            Company Staff        Michael Robinson
Telephone:            (304) 624-7002 [Day]     (304) 669-3008 [24/7]

                           



Risk Management Practices

A Summary of the Risk Management program Stockmeier Urethanes, Inc. regarding hazardous materials addressed in this RMP.

About Stockmeier Urethanes USA
We are a small automated Chemical Blending Facility that produces CASE Urethanes for sale to contractors in the Sports/Play Flooring industry, as well as rubber mold product manufactures and products used as adhesives.

Chemicals Covered by RMP
TDI 80/20 is used in sparse amounts in some of our products to obtain better physical properties.  

Description
Our TDI tank is enclosed in the Tank Storage Building attached to our facility. The tank has ample retention space below it, assuring that no material would escape beyond our walls.

Process
Pipes allow pumped material to enter the production room and into a Chemical reactor tank.  Here the TDI is blended into other ingredients, diluting and reacting it for finished product purposes.

Preventive Maintenance
Preventative Maintenance involves the regular inspection, testing, and cleaning of related facility equipment and operational systems.  These inspections will help to uncover conditions which might lead to a release of materials.  Thus, allowing for maintenance to prevent such a release.  We weekly inspect (and document) all material stora

ge equipment and containments for risk concerns.

Spill Prevention 
Spills are the largest risk.  We have developed clear, concise, and easy to follow spill prevention and response procedures for all applicable areas of the facility.  All employees are made aware of the proper procedures. Regarding TDI handling, we follow a check-list that covers all points of the unload from the Tank Wagon.  We have set-up devices to reduce the flow of material, should a problem occur.

Response Procedures
Our Plan includes a published Response Procedure.  All employees are taught what to do in case of an emergency.  Instructions are posted throughout the facility. Our ER Plan is assembled complete and available to all employees at any time.

Material Handling (TDI)
We have trained in the correct unloading procedures for the TDI we place into our storage tank.  A procedures checklist is completed step-by-step as the unloading process is performed.

Employee Training
Employee training is performed & documented.  The more knowledgeable all employees are about the facility's PLAN and what is to be expected of them, the greater the chance that the plan will be successful. Training will consist of on-the-job training and some class room training.

Diversions
Diversion practices have been installed to divert rain water away from high risk areas and prevent contaminates from mixing with the runoff.  These are surrounding the unloading ramp area

Containment    
Containment structures have been installed in the Tank Storage Area.  The containment structure exceeds are entire tank storage capacity. 
Catch basins are built into the ramp concrete.

Local Authorities
We have been inspected and permitted by the West Virginia DEP for Storm Water Pollution and for our Air Permit.
We have been inspected by our local government to assure no pollution into the municipal water/sewer system.
The Harrison County LEPC , led by the Fire Department have inspected, as well as toured (all their fire fighters)

our facility.
We have established an account with the local franchise of Safety-Kleen, so as to have them knowledgeable of our facility & materials in the case of an emergency clean-up required.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Michael A. Robinson
Vice President
Stockmeier Urethanes USA, Inc.
July 10, 2011
